events.description: The release of Japan's current account data for December 2025, showing a surplus below market expectations.

facts.fact_text: Japan’s current account surplus fell to JPY 728.8 billion in December 2025.

evidences.evidence_text: Japan’s current account surplus fell to JPY 728.8 billion in December 2025 from JPY 1,071.8 billion in the same month a year earlier

facts.fact_text: The primary income surplus decreased to JPY 1,189.4 billion.

evidences.evidence_text: The primary income surplus inched lower to JPY 1,189.4 billion from 1,248.9 billion

facts.fact_text: The services account recorded a deficit of JPY 340.1 billion.

evidences.evidence_text: the services account shifted to a deficit of JPY 340.1 billion from a small surplus of JPY 0.11 billion

facts.fact_text: The goods account surplus rose to JPY 134.9 billion with exports growing at 4.5%.

evidences.evidence_text: the surplus of goods account surged to JPY 134.9 billion from JPY 0.54 billion in the previous year, as exports (4.5%) rose faster than imports (3.7%)

claims.claim_text: The current account surplus was lower than what market analysts had predicted.

evidences.evidence_text: falling short of market forecasts of JPY 1,060 billion

evidence.evidence_text: the surplus of goods account surged to JPY 134.9 billion... as exports (4.5%) rose faster than imports (3.7%)
the services account shifted to a deficit of JPY 340.1 billion... Japan’s current account surplus fell to JPY 728.8 billion
Japan’s current account surplus fell to JPY 728.8 billion in December 2025
